name: ALENDRONATE SODIUM

ingredients.name: SODIUM STARCH GLYCOLATE TYPE A POTATO

( 1.6 )
contraindications: treatment osteoporosis postmenopausal women men : 10 mg daily 70 mg ( tablet ) weekly . ( 2.1 , 2.3 ) prevention osteoporosis postmenopausal women : 5 mg daily 35 mg weekly . ( 2.2 ) glucocorticoid-induced osteoporosis : 5 mg daily ; 10 mg daily postmenopausal women receiving estrogen . ( 2.4 ) paget 's disease : 40 mg daily six months . ( 2.5 ) instruct patients : ( 2.6 ) swallow tablets whole 6-8 ounces plain water least 30 minutes first food , drink , medication day . lie least 30 minutes taking alendronate sodium tablets food .
warningsAndPrecautions: 35 mg tablets alendronate sodium tablets usp , 35 mg white , capsule shaped , biconvex tablets debossed 'c223 ' one side plain side . ndc : 70518-1192-00 ndc : 70518-1192-01 packaging : 4 1 blister pack packaging : 3 1 carton , 4 1 blister pack storage store 20°c 25°c ( 68°f to77°f ) ; excursions permitted 15°c 30°c ( 59°f 86°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . dispense tight , light-resistant container . repackaged distributed : remedy repack , inc. 625 kolter dr. suite # 4 indiana , pa 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions: abnormalities esophagus delay esophageal emptying stricture achalasia [ ( 4 , 5.1 ) ] inability stand/sit upright least 30 minutes ( 2.6 , 4 , 5.1 ) hypocalcemia ( 4 , 5.2 ) hypersensitivity component product ( 4 , 6.2 )
indications_original: Alendronate sodium is a bisphosphonate indicated for: Treatment and prevention of osteoporosis in postmenopausal women ( 1.1 , 1.2 ) Treatment to increase bone mass in men with osteoporosis ( 1.3 ) Treatment of glucocorticoid-induced osteoporosis ( 1.4 ) Treatment of Paget's disease of bone ( 1.5 ) Limitations of use: Optimal duration of use has not been determined. For patients at low- risk for fracture, consider drug discontinuation after 3 to 5 years of use. (1.6)
contraindications_original: Treatment of osteoporosis in postmenopausal women and in men: 10 mg daily or 70 mg (tablet) once weekly. ( 2.1 , 2.3 ) Prevention of osteoporosis in postmenopausal women: 5 mg daily or 35 mg once weekly. ( 2.2 ) Glucocorticoid-induced osteoporosis: 5 mg daily; or 10 mg daily in postmenopausal women not receiving estrogen. ( 2.4 ) Paget's disease: 40 mg daily for six months. ( 2.5 ) Instruct patients to: ( 2.6 ) o   Swallow tablets whole with 6-8 ounces plain water at least 30 minutes before the first food, drink, or medication of the day. o   Not lie down for at least 30 minutes after taking alendronate sodium tablets and until after food.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
35 mg Tablets
                  Alendronate Sodium Tablets USP, 35 mg are white, capsule shaped, biconvex tablets debossed with 'C223' on one side and plain on the other side.
                  NDC: 70518-1192-00
                  NDC: 70518-1192-01
                  PACKAGING: 4 in 1 BLISTER PACK
                  PACKAGING: 3 in 1 CARTON, 4 in 1 BLISTER PACK
                  
                  Storage
                  Store at 20°C to 25°C (68°F to77°F); excursions permitted to 15°C to 30°C (59°F to 86°F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature].
                  Dispense in a tight, light-resistant container.
                  
                  Repackaged and Distributed By:
                  Remedy Repack, Inc.
                  625 Kolter Dr. Suite #4 Indiana, PA 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions_original: Abnormalities of the esophagus which delay esophageal emptying such as stricture or achalasia [see Warnings and Precautions ( 4 , 5.1 )] Inability to stand/sit upright for at least 30 minutes ( 2.6 , 4 , 5.1 ) Hypocalcemia ( 4 , 5.2 ) Hypersensitivity to any component of this product ( 4 , 6.2 )
